position.marginalia_text: Intelligit radios □ &Opposition; alicuius planet[a]e: qui radij proijciebantur ad &Sun; intraret aliquod ex quatuor signis mobilit[us]. // hoc etia[m] colligere potes ex sequentibus de &Moon; Imò et de suis proprijs radijs ess[e] rerum p[otes]t.

marginalia.translation: He understands the rays in the square or opposition of any planet: those which were thrown out towards the sun. He quickly reached any out of four signs. You can even collect this from the observations of the moon. Indeed, it can even be from the things' own rays themselves.

position.marginalia_text: Vide quid de radijs concurre[n]tibus ad eunde[m] locu[m] dicat.

marginalia.translation: Look what he says about the rays rallying towards the same place.

position.marginalia_text: Nota qua ratione directio bona impediatur. Et vo[c]e co[n]traria Iuvatur.

marginalia.translation: Note by which reason a good direction is hindered. And by a contrary voice he is assisted.

underline.text: Cum Sol aequinoctium facit, in locis quadratis & oppositis, fortior est
